bow: taking the hard way took my girls to meet with friend at the mall things were going well the girls were for the most part behaving when it was time to leave told she could pick out book at the book store she selected sophia the first book which is one of the few princesses do entirely mind waiting in line to buy the book got out of our sit stand stroller because she wanted to put the book on the counter started getting angry that was allowed to walk around and yet she was stuck in the stroller like some kind of chump because of this asked to get in the stroller and she could put the book on the counter from there this is apparently where went wrong by avoiding mini tantrum from the yr old inadvertently set into motion the beginning of great gigantic tantrum from the yr old after arguing with me apparently she thought thought she could reach the counter without being in the stroller and that was direct threat to her ability to be big girl we walk up to the counter and chucks the goddamn book on the counter now seeing as she is usually my good one throws things regularly was momentarily taken aback and thought it was an accident but one look at her stubborn set chin and fierce blue eyes told me that she done this deliberately she was testing me game on pick the book off the counter and say if you do apologize to the cashier you will not be getting this book the waterworks started immediately she grabs the book from my hand and tosses it on the counter again while telling me that she wo apologize at that moment had decision to make the tears were already here the screams were likely on their way had split second to decide how would handle this give in and buy the little brat her the book or haul very pissed off very loud yr old out to the car just glancing at the daring almost menacing glare she shot me gave me my answer calmly handed the book to the cashier apologized and told him we would be buying the book not sure if he ever said anything the screams had begun and with them came stomps on the stroller mad words and screeching pleas to let her say sorry so we could buy the book as best could ignored the disapproving looks from strangers as pushed my stroller complete with raging five year old we got to the car and was still pissed at me she got into the car and did the thing where the door did slam loud enough the first time so she kept opening it and slamming it shut again after the third time put an end to that too we talked on the way home after she calmed down about her feelings at the time of the incident and how she felt afterwards now we re home and made she sure understood why she was going to get the book not today not tomorrow perhaps not anytime in the near future and as recounted the story in my mind remembered the disapproving strangers and questioned myself had dealt with that scenario the right way in the second had to react and make choice on how to deal with and her tude my first instinct had been to give in is that what should ve done after all it only book but giving in would ve been the easy thing to do by giving into your child tantrums you re not only potentially creating bigger problem for yourself you re letting your kid down your job is to teach them how to function properly in society to be considerate of others to continue on and control your temper even if something does go your way so despite the judgmental glares and tsks of people do know stand by my choice for my child sake refrained from taking the easy way out and can only hope that at the very least she grew little because of it know have was unsure of where you going with this but think you made the right choice and did great job you explained to her what she did wrong her actions had consequences and you gave her chance to correct her behavior and apologize to the cashier this is one will have to remember you would have got the looks and tsks no matter if you gave in or stood your ground good job mama think you made the right choice about not buying the book after her misbehavior but can ask why your year old sits in stroller that seems bit old to me think your reaction to her small display of attitude escalated the whole situation out of proportion she was obviously having hard time managing to feel big and do think being punitive helps child manage their frustration or anger or attitude modeling and gentle instruction do certainly agree that one can not allow their children to misbehave and it is not out of line to expect certain standard of behaviour but also think you over reacted little empathy and little explanation in the moment could have gone long way to keeping the little brat from having melt down sometimes it about being proactive and not punitive the audacity of referring to child as little brat is beyond me *edit* am also of the belief and understanding child brain development that forcing child to apologize is not the way they learn how to be empathetic or sorrowful for their actions if you re interested in the material let me know and will link it it is sit and stand joovy caboose ultralight stroller we got when my youngest was born and my oldest was at the time this was few months ago we did have any other one and find this one works well when we re walking long places however we now have an umbrella stroller that we use most of the time the five year old hopped in and out but at the time needed her to stay in judgemental much dont call her brat around her wrote this an hour afterwards and was still upset did what thought was best at the time and am proud at the lesson both taught and learned shared not for criticism but to let others that have or will experience something similar know that they re not alone not judgmental at all just offering my view of the situation if you posted it not wanting anyone to comment in disagreement with your process perhaps that could have been included in your post so we know not to share alternative views actions believe strongly in peaceful kind gentle positive parenting so do agree with what you did nor with spreading the word that what you did was good idea this is reddit you re bound to encounter people who disagree with you but since when is having view that is completely opposite to yours judgmental the judgemental looks from strangers are what struggle with the most if choose to discipline my son because he misbehaving get looks if choose to allow him to misbehave get looks it frustrating and at times worry that just failing but you know what it none of their damn business if they want complete peace and quiet all the time they should stay home not my problem will have well adjusted child who knows how to behave in public and that what matters ignore them you did the right thing when child goes into meltdown mode reasoning is not always an option yes what she should ve done is gotten down on level talked to her through her screaming and explained that this was not acceptable behavior the continued to buy her the book and reward the unacceptable behavior because as long as it was rationalized with her it ok just learned about these strollers and seeing as have an almost year old and another on the way dying to get one you should google it they are pretty cool mean if that is how you think non punitive parenting works then you have some extra reading to do sadly people who are ignorant of the process respond the way you have believing that non punitive and peaceful means being permissive and rewards unacceptable behaviour it does and encourage you to learn more about it before assuming get one have year old and year old and it been great the year old thinks he like big boy able to get on and off himself but it still keeps him fairly contained awesome genuinely curious what would you have done in her situation agree with what op did so interested here you do agree with having her apologize for being rude to someone but you say you ca allow them to misbehave so what do you do also you do come off as judgmental when you judge someone for referring to their kid as brat in an anonymous internet post maybe you do intend to but that how it sounds sometimes parents let off steam that exactly what was hoping it would do for the big one mean he not quite big boy yet but he reminds me daily that he not my baby anymore lol different strokes what comes across as judgmental is your assumption that she was not showing empathy or explaining the situation and referring to harmless blowing off of steam as audacious if you simply written something like well prefer not to handle situations like this in that manner because try to handle them like instead do think anyone would have problem forced apologies are only done because they re forced there is not usually remorse so when we force child to say things which they do not mean what is the actual lesson they re learning not knowing her child specifically ca advise based on knowledge of her personality the way would with my own kids it is totally ok for mom to take her kids out of the line up stand aside and have connected moment so everyone can organize their feelings it seems that in this case the child was struggling with being interrupted from her goal of putting the book on the counter at that point getting on her level and helping her rationalize the idea as skywalker87 suggested may have worked to settle the situation right there reassurance that yes you can reach the counter and it all going to work out fine to purchase this book and shall we read it on the couch when we get home or on the bed to encourage distraction from the frustration coaxing her that this purchase is going to go off without hitch and she going to be big girl putting it on the counter so nicely in terms of tossing the book on the counter likely would have mentioned that this is not how we treat the book the counter or the pay lady and let us try that again with gentleness likely would have demonstrated in our family we allow reactions reactions are what they are you vitaminmary said that yourself when you said some parents let off steam all kids let off steam and need to know that their emotional responses are valid always we as parents do always see the innuendos of life the way kids do because we have more vast understanding of how the world works and what processes we go through to navigate the world little ones are still on the learning curve and rather than being punished for valid reaction as traditional parenting would dictate kids really need safe place to have emotions and an understanding that their reactions will be met with compassion and empathy rather than punishment it would be interesting to know what exactly the year old thought we do know because mama did try to find out mama reacted to the reaction in the moment we can all be sucked into that but being mindful that this is wee person just learning how to navigate the world needing instruction not punishment goes long way in helping us temper our responses it about paradigm shift from believing that child needs to be taught lesson to believing that we need to show the child how it is done by modeling it and that when it is done incorrectly punishment leads to resentment not learning since our goal is learning we want to make the environment and the message as conducive to learning as possible given what know about brain development in children know that the best way to do this is by positive gentle and kind parenting consider that as an adult you likely dig your heels in if someone disrespectfully ordered you to apologize for having reaction but you re grown and able to rationalize the situation whereas year old is not teaching children how to behave includes helping them understand the feelings of others as well forced apologies do not help them see the other side repeated instruction is needed for children to get it and the best instruction for children is modeling for the mama to say to the daughter can not let you treat books or people this way while removing the book from the counter and say to the clerk clearly in front of the daughter am sorry that book being thrown to her happened to you bet that did feel nice are you ok demonstrates that there is something to be sorrowful about the action and shows the child the way to empathize with the person they ve wronged there is no punishment needed further she been taught shown and told asking her to copy the gentle way mama puts the book down is the demonstration of the lesson and will be remembered as the lesson more so than the punishment of not getting book it is ok for parent to not feel like they have the time or the place to do this very involved very hands on type of parenting many of us feel like we have to just nip it in the bud right then and there reality is it takes many repetitions for child to understand each lesson we give them and we need not be overly harsh if we look at how we want to be treated when we re learning new things we can easily see how to treat our small humans it is not stretch to offer them respect when we expect to get respect how can they give something they ve not had or seen or experienced respect is not one way street the more we offer the more we get but first we have to believe that these are little humans who need teaching and just like in schools we no longer allow the teacher to rap child knuckles for missing spelling word because we know it is conducive to learning we also need to shift that view to our parenting discipline means to guide and well disciplined child is one who is well guided in terms of the brat issue it just so harsh to view child that way as deliberately being unacceptable child giving hard time rather than child having hard time firmly believe no know that children who are having hard time will be children who give hard time and that the former must always be present for the
